page.description: If the UX has been bound to tables, sets the primary key value for the specified table alias.

argument.name: value
argument.description: An array specifying the primary key value to set. The key value is always a Javascript array of character data (even if the primary key is a single column). If value is set to *[js:'__undefinedkey__']* the key is deleted.

argument.name: row
argument.description: Optional. The table alias or a row in a repeating section, depends on source data. If row is not specified, the alias is a top level alias. Otherwise, row indicates the row in a Repeating Section.

page.example: //Set the primary key for the INVOICE_ITEMS alias in row 3 of the Repeating Section to ['23','11']. {dialog.Object}.setKey('INVOICE_ITEMS',['23','11'],3);
